Couldn't agree more. 

I've also wanted chromas for Vanilla {{champion:44}}, but in truth, chromas for ANY of his skins would work fine. Armor of the Fifth Age chromas would likely be especially popular (since that's the must-have Taric skin).

lmao I'm all for it. I was going to say something about it being rather tragic that he won't be pink anymore, and that's true.

BUT, don't you want a rainbow assortment for Taric's chocies? Isn't that equally appropriate?
Considering chromas tend to have names like "amethyst" and other gem names it makes a ton of sense too.
They said they don't make chromas for Classic skins anymore but i'm sure her skins are great candidates too.
I woulda been fine if they kept making chroma's for classics. Really adds flavor for the base imo. I understand it's more of an incentive to buy skins with chromas tho.

Yeah well...what's the point if you can unlock Chromas for free basically.

Damn business strats!
What about Thresh? All they would have to do is change the color he glows.

Most of his skins technically do that already. 

For instance, why would I buy a red thresh chroma when I can have blood moon.
Or the other way around. Why buy blood moon if you can get a red chroma? Or championship if you can have a blue one?

Because...the difference is decorations, abilities and recall animations.

You'd basically be buying a very shitty version of a skin in that way which is not very profitable.

It's cheaper.

I mean, they released Omega Squad Tristana when Guerrilla Tristana already exists, so clearly this is an acceptable business model.

I'm pretty sure they put her on the squad simply because she's an Adc and she's a yordle.

Making entire chroma sets for champions based on this alone is a weak argument.
Didn't say I agreed with it, just that it's something Riot already does. Ergo, no reason to doubt that they'd do something similar.

I didn't say you agreed with it either. I'm saying that assuming Riot would add an entire new layer of chromas based on a single misfitting skin isn't a very solid argument.

And tbh i feel like Guerilla Tristana was simply overlooked because that skin is so old now, you may aswell buy that as a cheaper version of an Omega skin.

why do people buy elderwood bard when there is a green base bard chroma.

Why do people buy snow bard when there is a blue chroma.

why do people buy bard bard when there is a red chroma.

It's because those skins bring something new to the table, an are quite good.

If anything all champions having chroma's is just a way for the skin team to promise us that their skins will still continue to be of excellent quality.
Why not a Spring/Summer/Autumn/Winter theme?

That's reserved for the 4 seasons ultimate skin she's going to have.

**SHE IS GOING TO HAVE**
I feel like it might overlap with Elementalist Lux a little bit if it were an ultimate, but I don't think she shouldn't get it at some point.

I thought they said there weren't doing chromas for base skins any more. Though maybe for Wildfire.

Did they? Well let me show you how they change their opinion!

**3000 GOLD FOR THESE CHROMA**
How much is 3000 gold in RP?

>How much is 3000 gold in RP?

I'll accept that challenge!

_Gonna do this in my most non-sarcastic voice._

Rounding off to two decimals here:

Gold is by default measured in troy ounces.
3000 troy ounces equals 93,31 Kg.
The current going rate for gold is 40.972,91 USD per Kilo.
93,31 Kg then equals 3.823.182,23 USD or 3.257.238,26 EUR

Using my RP - EUR pricing chart (using the EU 12575 RP bundle as baseline), that equals 585.724.727,01 RP.
That's 180.222 Ultimate skins (and 3218 RP left over).

Over half a Billion RP... As they say, "don't spend it all in one place". xD

_Now I'm just hoping no numbers are mistyped anywhere..._
